articleguidance-specialnewarticle-search: Title shown at the top of the search step asking users what they want to write about
articleguidance-specialnewarticle-title-: Placeholder text for the Wikidata search input field
articleguidance-specialnewarticle-loadin: Loading state message displayed while searching Wikidata
articleguidance-specialnewarticle-checki: Progress indicator message displayed while checking search results against available outlines
articleguidance-specialnewarticle-no-res: Message shown when no Wikidata entities match the search query. Parameters: $1 is the search query text
articleguidance-specialnewarticle-exists:
Warning message shown when the user types an article title that already exists. Parameters:
* $1 - The article title that already exists
articleguidance-specialnewarticle-edit-e: Button text for navigating to edit the existing article that was found
articleguidance-specialnewarticle-disamb: Heading shown above the topic match cards when Wikidata returns results
articleguidance-specialnewarticle-browse: First part of the button text to browse all available article type outlines when the user cannot find what they are looking for in the search results
Second part of the button text to browse all available article type outlines when the user cannot find what they are looking for in the search results
articleguidance-outlines-browse-title: Title shown when browsing all available article types in the outlines step
articleguidance-outlines-browse-subtitle: Subtitle shown when browsing all available article types in the outlines step. Parameters: $1 is the article title
articleguidance-sources-title: Title of the sources step where users add references
articleguidance-sources-subtitle: Subtitle of the sources step. Parameters: $1 is the article title
articleguidance-sources-notability-title: Heading for the notability warning section shown when an article type has notability risk
articleguidance-sources-notability-descr: Description text explaining why references are particularly important for article types with notability concerns
articleguidance-sources-references-title: Heading for the references section in the sources step
articleguidance-sources-description: Description text explaining the benefits of adding sources for any article type
articleguidance-sources-url-placeholder: Placeholder text for the URL input field where users enter source URLs to verify
articleguidance-sources-check-button: Button text to verify and add a source URL
articleguidance-sources-remove-button: Button text to remove a verified source from the list
articleguidance-sources-unreliable-domai: Error message displayed when a URL is from an unreliable domain (social media, AI-generated content, etc.)
articleguidance-sources-invalid-url: Error message displayed when the entered text is not a valid URL
articleguidance-sources-continue: Button text to continue from the sources step to the instructions step
articleguidance-instructions-subtitle: Subtitle of the instructions step. Parameters: $1 is the label of the selected Wikidata entity
articleguidance-instructions-references-: Heading for the references section shown when the article type has notability risk
Description text explaining why references are needed for article types with notability concerns
articleguidance-instructions-reference-p: Placeholder text for reference URL input fields. Parameters: $1 is the reference number (1-4)
articleguidance-instructions-start-writi: Button text to start writing the article in the editor
articleguidance-navigation-back: Button text for the back navigation button
articleguidance-tracking-category: Tracking category name for pages that use the article-guidance tag. See [[Special:TrackingCategories]].
articleguidance-tracking-category-desc: Description of the tracking category for pages using article-guidance tags, shown on [[Special:TrackingCategories]].
